lj.lj_ly: Wendy drank half the bottle straight off.
come on, Bert, I won't hurt you—straight up.

真正的不带冰的马丁尼酒

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as an adjective and adverb): archaic past participle of stretch

entry.def: A straight line or edge continues in the same direction and does not bend or curve.

example.ex: Keep the boat in a straight line...
example.tran: 让船保持直线航行。

example.ex: Using the straight edge as a guide, trim the cloth to size...
example.tran: 用直尺比照着，将布料裁剪成合适的尺寸。

entry.def: Straight hair has no curls or waves in it.

example.ex: Grace had long straight dark hair which she wore in a bun.
example.tran: 格雷斯把一头长长的黑色直发盘成发髻。

entry.def: You use straight to indicate that the way from one place to another is very direct, with no changes of direction.

example.ex: The ball fell straight to the feet of Klinsmann...
example.tran: 球直接落到了克林斯曼的脚上。

example.ex: He finished his conversation and stood up, looking straight at me...
example.tran: 他说完话站起来，直视着我。

entry.def: If you go straight to a place, you go there immediately.

example.ex: As always, we went straight to the experts for advice...
example.tran: 像往常一样，我们马上去找专家咨询。

example.ex: We'll go to a meeting in Birmingham and come straight back.
example.tran: 我们将去伯明翰参加会议，然后马上回来。

entry.tran: 直截了当的;直率的;坦诚的
entry.def: If you give someone a straight answer, you answer them clearly and honestly.

example.ex: What a shifty arguer he is, refusing ever to give a straight answer.
example.tran: 他真是个狡诈的辩论家，总是拒绝给出直截了当的回答。

entry.def: Straight means following one after the other, with no gaps or intervals.

example.ex: They'd won 12 straight games before they lost.
example.tran: 他们在输掉比赛之前已连续赢了12场。

entry.tran: 只涉及两人(或两物)的;(选择)非此即彼的
entry.def: A straight choice or a straight fight involves only two people or things.

example.ex: It's a straight choice between low-paid jobs and no jobs...
example.tran: 只有两个选择：要么是报酬很低的工作，要么就是失业。

example.ex: Each has several times beaten the other in a straight fight.
example.tran: 双方都曾在单打比赛中击败过对方几次。

entry.tran: 正经的;正统的;规矩本分的
entry.def: If you describe someone as straight, you mean that they are normal and conventional, for example in their opinions and in the way they live.

example.ex: Dorothy was described as a very straight woman, a very strict Christian who was married to her job.
example.tran: 多萝西被形容成一个非常正统的女人，一个尽职尽责、非常虔诚的基督徒。

entry.def: If you describe someone as straight, you mean that they are heterosexual rather than homosexual.

example.ex: His sexual orientation was a lot more gay than straight...
example.tran: 从他的性取向来看，他不像异性恋，更像个同性恋。

example.ex: Marty of New York describes herself as a straight female.
example.tran: 纽约的马蒂称自己不是女同性恋者。

entry.tran: (尤指酒精饮料)纯的，不掺水的
entry.def: A straight drink, especially an alcoholic drink, has not had another liquid such as water added to it.

example.ex: ...a large straight whiskey without ice...
example.tran: 不加冰的大杯纯威士忌

example.ex: Children should not drink fruit juices straight.
example.tran: 儿童不应该喝纯果汁。

entry.def: On a racetrack, a straight is a section of the track that is straight, rather than curved.

example.ex: Our cars were clearly too slow along the straights...
example.tran: 我们的赛车在直道上跑得显然太慢了。

example.ex: I went to overtake him on the back straight on the last lap.
example.tran: 最后一圈时我在非终点直道上超过了他。

entry.def: If you get something straight, you make sure that you understand it properly or that someone else does.

example.ex: You need to get your facts straight...
example.tran: 你需要讲清楚你的情况。

example.ex: Let's get things straight. I didn't lunch with her.
example.tran: 咱们把事情说清楚。我没有和她一起吃午饭。

entry.tran: 改过自新;改邪归正;重新做人
entry.def: If a criminal is going straight, they are no longer involved in crime.
If something keeps people on the straight and narrow, it helps to keep them living an honest or healthy life.

example.ex: All her efforts to keep him on the straight and narrow have been rewarded.
example.tran: 她为了让他走正道所作出的一切努力都得到了回报。

means.word_mean: 1. a heterosexual person; someone having a sexual orientation to persons of the opposite sex

3. a straight segment of a roadway or racecourse
3. (of hair) having no waves or curls;

"I just want a straight answer to the question"

means.word_mean: 15. following a correct or logical method;

sentences.sentence: "the path leads directly to the lake"

means.word_mean: 2. in a forthright manner; candidly or frankly;

sentences.sentence: "came out flat for less work and more pay"

means.word_mean: 3. in a straight line; in a direct course;

Sentence.sentence: It's about fifty-five miles southwest from here and the road is not at all straight.

psychiatrist (心理医生) at the University of California, San Diego, said older people are more likely to suffer from broken sleep, while younger people are better at sleeping efficiently straight through the night.
Swim straight into the same tank.
Or you can be the honest type negotiator who's known to his partners in negotiation and always plays everything straight.
Honey, I'll be going straight to the theatre from work this evening.

sentences.en: There is a straight line under the sentence.
The straight flow of the brook formed a ravine.
sentences.cn: 不间断的溪水形成了一个峡谷。

sentences.en: He is straight in his dealings.
You get straight A in the exam.
His hot pancakes are delicious, you buy them straight from the kitchen to eat in your hands.
sentences.cn: 他卖的热烙饼味道真好, 一做好你就可以直接买来用手拿着吃。

sentences.en: He went straight from school to university.
sentences.cn: 他中学一毕业就马上进了大学。

jushi.english: Light is propagated through the air in a straight line.
jushi.chinese: 光是以一直线经由空中传送的。

jushi.english: He kept making ambiguous remarks instead of straightforward yes-or-no replies.
jushi.chinese: 他连续地讲些模棱两可的话,而不是作出明确的肯定或否定的回答。
